page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY & SUPERNATURAL
page.content: The original Denton (Town in the hole) was in the valley by the church, built C12. After the Great Plaque in C17 villagers moved up the hill. Family farmhouses were built about 1650 with a few fields enclosing stock. The {Chapel}was built 1655 by Thomas Lawson and was the Mother church for the area. The present Chapel was rebuilt in 1821 following a fire. The late Saxon Motte & Bailey{Castle} is on Castle Hill, next to Hangmans Hill. Many finds of pottery etc. here. Local names are taken from History. Misery corner, a pond where a young woman in blue drowned, her headless {Ghost}has been seen.Well corner, sight of a well & cottages, Ghost of a grey nunn seen there occasionally. 400 American Airmen were based on the {airfield}during the war,some come back to visit from time to time.
